Translation of 楚竹書・鄭子家亡(en) into English.

p.seg: When Zheng Zijia died,
the officials and soldiers at the border came to report about it.
King Zhuang approached the daifu
and told them:
“Zheng Zijia killed his lord,
I wanted (even) before to tell the daifu,
(but) because of the gravity of the crisis of the state (I did not).
From now on,
the state of Chu must be ruled by the main houses.
Now, Zheng Zijia has killed his own ruler,
if we will bury him in our land with a good name,
and if the lord on high and the ghosts and spirits because of this will be angered,
how will I answer?
Even if the state is in crisis,
we must get ready to use the army.
Now if we raise the army,
we will encircle Zheng in three months.
The people of Zheng asked why,
and the king answered them:
“Zheng Zijia has overturned the rites under Heaven,
not fearing the displeasure of the ghosts,
and killed his lord.
I will have to act so that Zijia will not establish his name above because of this,
and I will extinguish xx below.
The people of Zheng asked that (the king) make a pledge for Ziliang [=Zijia?],
ordering to make for him a three inch thick coffin of pear wood,
tied with a lax rope,
not daring to come out of the (city’s) gates,
they buried him at the base of the (city) wall.
The king agreed to that.
When the army had not yet returned,
the people of Jin crossed the river,
in order to save Zheng,
and the king returned.
